description.p: Your patron is an Ocean Guardian, a mysterious and immortal entity of the ocean, associated with the elemental plane of water. They are immensely old and powerful, and often considered a noble in divine, fey, or elemental courts. They are a steward of the harmony and peace of the oceans, protecting sentient beings such as coastal residents, merfolk, sea elves, selkies, and tritons.

The Ocean Guardian may also protect animals such as dolphins, whales, and sharks. Or they may preserve and defend ecosystems such as coral reefs and kelp forests. Appearing before mortals, they usually take the form of a sea creature, but may be much larger or much more otherworldly in some manner. They take many forms such as the form of a sea turtle rescuing a drowning sailor or a hippocampus guiding a ship safely through a storm.

An Ocean Guardian will act as a patron for a warlock for a number of reasons. It could be to gather information on land, to defend nature, to fight against evil forces of the ocean, to stop murderous pirates, or to simply promote the greater good beyond its aquatic reach.

div.p: An Ocean Guardian often serves the good or neutral deity of the ocean. However, the role of the Ocean Guardian is flexible to suit the backstory of your character and campaign. For example:

ul.li: They can serve a good ocean god such as Deep Sashelas in the Forgotten Realms.
For neutral ocean gods, such as Procam in Greyhawk, the Ocean Guardian can act as a champion of good in their realm.
The Ocean Guardian may instead be affiliated with gods of nature, protection, or duty. This can be the case especially if the ocean god is evil, like The Devourer in Eberron.
The Ocean Guardian can serve or act themselves as an elder elemental.
Alternatively, the Ocean Guardian can be an independent, unaffiliated entity. They may act as the good antithesis to krakens, leviathans, and other otherworldy horrors of the deep oceans.

td.em: create or destroy water, absorb elements

description.p: Starting at the 1st level, your patron bestows upon you certain powers of the elemental plane of water. Take shape water as a bonus cantrip. You can read, speak, and understand Primordial and its dialects.

At 1st level your patron provides you with the healing magic of sacred waters. You can cast cure wounds at your highest warlock spell level once per long rest without expending a spell slot. If the target is on fire, this ability extinguishes them. At the 5th level, the sacred waters whirl around your target in a protective coil. Until the start of your next turn, your target gains a temporary AC bonus equal to your Charisma modifier. At the 10th level, you can summon the waters to a target and the range increases to 30 feet.

description.p: At the 6th level you are granted powers of the ocean, fully accepted as a defender of the aquatic. You can breathe underwater and you have a swim speed equal to your walking speed. You may communicate telepathically with any creatures with a natural swimming speed within 30 feet.

sheet.description: You can breathe underwater. You may communicate telepathically with any creatures with a natural swimming speed within 30 feet.

description.p: At the 10th level, you channel the power of the depths. You gain resistance to cold and fire damage.
At the 14th level, even without sight, your patron grants you blindsight to a distance of up to 30 feet.

sheet.description: Your patron grants you blindsight to a distance of 30 feet.

description.p: At the 14th level, as an action, you open a path to the elemental plane of water. Either waves of crashing force or mists of healing power descend upon up to six creatures within 30 feet of you. An ally will heal 4d8 + your Charisma modifier. An enemy must make a Strength saving throw, if they fail they take 10d6 bludgeoning damage plus your Charisma modifier and are knocked prone. If they succeed they take half damage but are not knocked prone. You may use this ability once per long rest.
